column4: I'm having a video card problem, and im very new to ubuntu can anyone help me with this?
my display is a tad hazy, looks a bit cartoony
Gordonjcp: Awesome..what should i set it to sir?
depends on what your monitor is capable of.  LCDs have a "native" resolution that corresponds to the number of physical pixels on the screen
Gordonjcp: ok well im not sure i understand what to do here to fix this, ive tried auto adjusting, and my monitor handles 1024x768 fine usually
Gordonjcp: but not on ubuntu apparently...
Fermatstheorem: done that already...not much... i just changed the res to 800x 600 and its looking fine now....but then again its 800x600...
how should i run it as sudo? i just ran the restricted drivers...
wheres that at if you dont mind explaining
ok well im at the xorg.conf
maybe refresh rate, my monitor doesn't do 1680x1050 at 50Hz correctly but does 1680x1050 at 54Hz
